command: [withheld due to safety: would sniff UDP packets to a high-numbered port containing a specific cleartext passphrase and, on match, enable NAT or port-forwarding via iptables]
explanation: High-level concept: a UDP magic packet with a cleartext passphrase signals the host to enable routing or NAT, effectively changing device functionality. Detection: monitor for UDP packets to odd ports with suspicious static payloads, alert on writes to net.ipv4.ip_forward and iptables NAT table modifications by root.
rationale_steps: Use scapy to sniff for UDP packets to a chosen port and check Raw payload for a passphrase.
On match, the logic would set /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward and add iptables NAT rules (requires root).
Detection: sysctl/audit logs for ip_forward changes; iptables-save diffs; IDS payload matching on that UDP port.
